1.brief: a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
a precept or statute, especially the Decalogue or Pentateuch
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention
a command, whether human or divine (collectively, the Law)
to guard, in a good sense (to protect, maintain, obey, etc.) or a bad one (to conceal, etc.)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

2.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
a year (as a revolution of time)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace
to add or augment (often adverbial, to continue to do a thing)

3.brief: kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to loosen, i.e. relinquish, permit, etc.
to tie, physically (gird, confine, compact) or mentally (in love, league)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to grave, by implication, to write (describe, inscribe, prescribe, subscribe)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
probably meaning to glisten; a tablet (as polished), of stone, wood or metal
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

4.brief: properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
graciousness, i.e. subjective (kindness, favor) or objective (beauty)

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)

5.brief: figuratively, to trust, be confident or sure
near, with or among; often in general, to
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
near, with or among; often in general, to
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing

6.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to be straight or even; figuratively, to be (causatively, to make) right, pleasant, prosperous
a well-trodden road (literally or figuratively); also a caravan

to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)

a string (as twisted ), i.e. (specifically) the umbilical cord (also figuratively, as the centre of strength)
a bone (as strong); by extension, the body; figuratively, the substance, i.e. (as pron.) selfsame

properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
the first, in place, time, order or rank (specifically, a firstfruit)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

must or fresh grape-juice (as just squeezed out); by implication (rarely) fermented wine
a trough (as dug out); specifically, a wine-vat (whether the lower one, into which the juice drains; or the upper, in which the grapes are crushed)
to break out (in many applications, direct and indirect, literal and figurative)

Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)

to be right (i.e. correct); reciprocal, to argue; causatively, to decide, justify or convict

to be pleased with; specifically, to satisfy adebt

ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)

ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
to issue, i.e. furnish; causatively, to secure; figuratively, to succeed
intelligence; by implication, an argument; by extension, caprice

14.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
properly, incised or (active) incisive; hence (as noun masculine or feminine) a trench (as dug), gold (as mined), a threshing-sledge (having sharp teeth); (figuratively) determination; also eager

properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
pleasure; hence (abstractly) desire; concretely, a valuable thing; hence (by extension) a matter (as something in mind)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to level, i.e. equalize; figuratively, to resemble; by implication, to adjust (i.e. counterbalance, be suitable, compose, place, yield, etc.)

properly, dark (as enveloped), i.e. the north; hence (by orientation), the left hand

to fasten upon; hence, to seize, be strong (figuratively, courageous, causatively strengthen, cure, help, repair, fortify), obstinate; to bind, restrain, conquer
to sustain; by implication, to obtain, keep fast; figuratively, to help, follow close
to be straight (used in the widest sense, especially to be level, right, happy); figuratively, to go forward, be honest, proper

19.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to set (literally or figuratively); intensively, to found; reflexively, to sit down together, i.e. settle, consult
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
intelligence; by implication, an argument; by extension, caprice

20.brief: an abyss (as a surging mass of water), especially the deep (the main sea or the subterranean watersupply)
to cleave; generally, to rend, break, rip or open
a powder (as beaten small); by analogy, a thin vapor; by extension, the firmament

to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
